Header: 90 pct of African swine fever blockades lifted in China
Content: China has lifted 100 African swine fever blockades due to the improved situation, accounting for 90 percent of the total. The outbreak of African swine fever, first found in the northeastern province of Liaoning last August, has brought 111 outbreaks in 28 provincial regions so far. In a bid to control the escalating disease, authorities have strengthened supervision and taken strict measures, such as carrying out meticulous inspection, banning the feeding of pigs with kitchen leftovers, as well as restricting the transportation of pigs and pork products in the affected areas.
